FuncDef:
The ipv4-family vpnv4-multicast command creates end enters the BGP-VPNv4-Multicast address family view.
The undo ipv4-family vpnv4-multicast command deletes the configurations in the BGP-VPNv4-Multicast address family.
By default, the BGP-IPv4 unicast address family view is displayed.

ParaDef.Info:
Displays the BGP-VPNv4-Multicast address family view. In this address family, BGP can establish IBGP peer relationships only.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Before performing BGP configurations in an IPv4 address family, you need to run the ipv4-family command in the BGP view to enable the IPv4 address family and enter the address family view. By default, BGP uses the IPv4 unicast address family.
Configuration Impact
To disable the IPv4 unicast address family, run the undo default ipv4-unicast command.
Precautions
The undo ipv4-family command cannot delete the BGP-IPv4 unicast address family view.
If the undo ipv4-family command is run, the VPN target and IPv4 configurations of the VPN are deleted. Therefore, exercise caution when running this command.
